column1: 142kph, back of a length, nipping in, comes off the inside edge into the groin of de Kock. That winded him first up
142kph, short and wide, nicely placed cut shot controlled past backward point wide of third man for a couple
149kph, very full, almost a yorker length, no swing, he drives back to the bowler
144kph, similar length, very full, he checks the drive to cover
148kph, perfect length on off stump, he's pressing forward and pushing firmly to mid off
148kph, half volley, he steers this drive with control, doesn't overhit, places it between point and cover, nicely placed but not timed well enough to reach the rope
134kph, fifth stump line, perfect length, hint of away swing, he's happy to let this go out of the hand
134kph, beaten. Another good length, a touch closer, he tries to defend on the front foot but it shapes past the edge
133kph, good length, this nips back quick a long way and hits him on the thigh pad
135kph, good length, angled into off, no swing, he's half forward and defending to cover
shorter length, off stump line, he's back and across defending back to the bowler
135kph, way wide of off, and he has no interest in playing at this, leaves it alone

caught behind! Brilliant start by Starc. This was the perfect line, fourth stump line, great length, he prods at it, it just straightens off the surface and tickles the edge and an easy catch behind for Carey.
beaten seaming across the right hander. 142kph, pitched on off, he was squared up as it seams across him
144kph, shorter on leg stump he clips this nicely off the thigh behind square for a couple
146kph, pushed way wide of off and he is happy to leave this decisively
145kph, very full on off stump, he pushes on the front foot, times it nicely but straight to mid off
145kph, cracking bouncer, well directed, but Markram is quickly ducking underneath it
134kph, good length, a touch shorter, he's back and across and defending back to the bowler
131kph, top of off stump, he's defending from the crease towards mid on
135kph, dragged way wide of off, might have stuck in the bowler's hand there, not a tough call for the umpire Paul Wilson
133kph, good length, tight to off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
chipped in the air just short of midwicket! Leg stump line but not that full, it held in the wicket a touch as he played out in front but it fell well short of Cummins
131kph, nipping back into the thigh and drops away on the leg side, they call quickly and zip through for one
good length, seaming away a touch, he's drawn to play, it comes off the thick edge but rolls along the ground through a vacant gully to third man
good length on middle stump, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
145kph, angled down leg, comes off the pad and Carey takes it brilliantly with a diving left hand to prevent four leg byes. No appeal for a catch at all
146kph, on the pads, he clips this, nails it, and it nearly carries to Cummins at square midwicket! He hit this so sweetly
shorter ball outside off, lifting, he's up on his toes and defending, knocking it down on the off side
145kph, good length, fourth stump line, he's forward with a good stride to defend under his eyes
147kph, fuller, fourth stump line outside off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
good length, this kicks off a length a touch, hits the splice of the bat as he defends from the crease. He rips the bottom hand off the bat as he knocks it down
134kph, good length again, he's back this time to defend the bounce better into the off side
perfect length, top of off, he defends turning the blade towards midwicket
inside edge onto pad prevents a huge LBW shout because it was full and he was right back infront of the stumps
drives on the up, slicing it to backward point and Maxwell makes an excellent diving stop to his left. Saves multiple runs
punched off the back foot through cover! What a stroke! This wasn't that short or wide, he stands up and punches with a short arm jab and timed this so well, it raced to the fence. Incredible timing
134kph, shorter length on off, he's back and defending into the off side
135kph, shorter length into the hip, he can't clip this away, in comes off thigh pad and rolls to the off side
good length, fourth stump line, he's squared up defending off the back foot to point
138kph, angled down leg, it comes off the thigh guard and rolls to fine leg
back of a length on off, he is back and defending into the leg side
138kph, good length, nipping back hitting the top of the pad but it's high and going down leg

run out chance and Cummins misses! This was a huge mix up, he tucked a ball straight to Cummins right at midwicket and took off, definitely no run there. He was sent back, Cummins slid and threw in the one motion, but had much more time, and missed. He would have been miles out
good length, defends from the crease to mid off
133kph, fuller length, he drives on the up, past the bowler, to straight mid off and it's cut off
good length, middle and leg, clipped straight to midwicket and there is a loud call of 'wait!'
cracking pull shot over deep square! What a shot! Just a fraction short and Markram pounced, he swivelled and smashed it over square leg flat into the second row of seats
134kph, slightly fuller, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
tickled fine! Easy leg glance. This was a freebie down leg, very full, he glanced it easily fine for four
beaten outside off. Slightly angled in, good length, straightening away a touch past the probing edge
dropped at cover! Really tough chance. It was a good length, it held up in the surface, he checked the drive, hit it in the air to cover's right, Travis Head flies one handed but can't hold on.
good length well wide of off, he leaves this alone
beaten again! A good length again angled in and seaming away a touch but it was wide, he shuffled back and across but played inside the line as it zipped past
139kph, nipping down the leg side and he can't glance this one
136kph, shorter length on off, he's jumping back and defending into the off side
122kph, back of a length, straighter on middle, he's back and working this through square leg to the sweeper

caught behind down the leg side! It wasn't a good ball, shorter down leg, he tries to glance it fine, got a little tickle off the face of the bat, Carey diving low and forward to his left takes a good catch. Stoinis has the magic touch
124kph, good length, well wide of off and he leaves it alone
122kph, off cutter, shorter length, he's back and across and working this into the gap at square leg
124kph, full angled into off, he works this on the front foot to midwicket
123kph, good length, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
138kph, full outside off, driven firmly straight to cover
138kph, good length on off, he's back and across and defending to point
138kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease to mid on
139kph bouncer, he tried to pull but half bailed out as it whizzed past his head, Maxwell yelled from point thinking there was a noise but no one else went up
139kph back of a length off stump line, he defends off the back foot into the off side
141kph, good length, off stump line, he defends from the crease with the full face of the bat
125kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
126kph, beautifully driven on the up wide of mid off, it wasn't a half-volley, but he controlled this and placed this nicely
127kph, good length, he's back and across and defending from the crease
incredible shot working this with the wrists from a length of off stump wide of mid on and it races away with superb timing
shorter length angled to off, he turns this on the front foot to midwicket
pulled over backward square again into the stands! Short ball at 124kph, he swivels again and just picks it up and lofts this with control and it carries all the way. You can't bowl there to Markram
138kph, good length, off stump line, he defends on the front foot back down the wicket
139kph, fourth stump line, perfect length, he defends on the front foot again to point
141kph, climbs off a length, he gets surprised by the bounce and gets a leading edge but it falls well short of cover
142kph, shorter length on leg stump, turns this away nicely through square leg
140kph, good length, angled into off, he turns with the angle through forward square leg
139kph, well wide of off, he's happy to leave, not quite short enough to cut
125kph, back of a length middle and off, he defends on the back foot to midwicket

another pull shot out of the ground! Too short again and this is a free pickings for Markram. He rocks back and smashes this up and over deep square and it flies over the fence, over the hill, over the back fence and down the street
124kph, angled into leg stump, tucked easily off the pads to deep square leg
124kph, back of a length, outside off, he defends on the back foot into the off side

skips down the track and lofts this back over the bowler's head! He predicted the length, skipped down to the pitch and lifted it up and over straight down the ground, didn't over hit it, it rolled easily to the rope
fuller length, on off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
slides through, hits him on the pad big appeal but it was sliding down
fuller on leg, he drives back to the bowler
tossed up, driven inside out through cover-point to the sweeper
89kph, flighted leg break outside off, he pushes away to point
88kph tossed up leg break, full, driven firmly to long off
shorter outside off, cut very hard to Head at a closish point, he does well to knock it down but pinch one as it rolls behind him
wide half-volley angled across, big lash at a drive but misses
138kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to cover

strangled down the leg side again! Unbelievable! This was a horrible delivery way down leg, a half-volley, he tried to flick it away and got a little tickle off the face and Carey takes another catch behind moving down the leg side.
141kph, full tailing in a touch, on off stump, he defends on the front foot with the angle into the leg side
lofted up over cover! Wow. Some shot to get off the mark. This was full but not a half-volley, he check drives and lofts it up and over cover and times it magnificently. It fles to the rope
good length, wider of off, he leaves this one alone
tossed up leg break on off, 88kph, he drives to long off
flatter on leg stump, he's back and working this through midwicket to the sweeper
wider on the crease, leg break towards off, he defends on the front foot
flipper skids through, he shapes to pull, it skids low, hits the pad, they appeal, not out. It was going down leg.
tossed up on middle, driven to long on
looped leg break, pitched on leg, he stands up and defends from the crease
length at off stump, defended
ouch! Nasty blow for du Plessis as this jags up from back of a length. Leaps at him and takes the bottom glove and handle of the bat. He drops the bat to the ground
pushes a length delivery towards mid-on
touch fuller, he comes forward and drives into the covers
full and straight, neatly turned through midwicket with a flick of the bottom hand
a short ball, 142kph, at off stump and it's jabbed down into the off side
full outside off, he drives and it skews off a thick edge to short third man
gets forward and drives down the ground to long-off
full outside off, Miller brings out the slog sweep, goes all along the ground to deep square
full at the pads, tucked through square leg and they are alert to the chance of a second
nice delivery, good length at middle, defended into midwicket
fuller, at the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
full outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, he tries to shovel into the leg side but finds midwicket
aggression from the captain as he uses his feet and then drives with power through the covers, wide of the sweeper
length outside off, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
down the pitch again, it'a a shorter ball this time and he pulls out to deep square
works a length delivery off his pads behind square on the leg side, placed nicely
works a straight delivery into the leg side
short outside off, he rocks backs and carves it through the covers wide of the sweeper
comes down the pitch, makes it into a very full delivery, drives to mid-off
on the pads but Miller misses out as he flicks to square leg
nice shape, good length at middle, straightens a touch and worked to midwicket
a little flatter, on off stump, punched straight back down the pitch...decent stuff from Zampa
just wide of midwicket as he flicks a full delivery and doesn't quite keep it down
pitches outside leg stump, takes the pad down the side, Carey cuts it off. The way Australia have go so far, maybe that line is a tactic
good length at off stump, defended
tries to come down the pitch, can only nudge a straight delivery back to the bowler
back of a length, worked off the stumps through midwicket
full outside off, nicely into a punchy drive which finds cover
he breaks the shackles with a big slog sweep, a fulll delivery on the stumps, Miller goes down on his back knee and connects sweetly
pushed across flatter outside off, beats Miller's attempt to cut
worked off the pads to square leg
very full at the stumps, dug out into the off side
a full toss which is pushed down the ground to long-on
another very full one, he drives hard into the ground and it bounces over cover to the right of mid-off
full at off stump, 135kph, nicely forward into a drive which finds mid-off
worked off the stumps to the on side
back of a length, straight, no width for Miller to work with as he plays to the on side
pushes at a length delivery angled across, healthy outside edge down to third man...no slips in place
full outside off, du Plessis ponders an aggressive option for a second but then leaves it alone
this time there is aggression as he uses his feet again, drives on the up to deep point
round the wicket, full and straight, tapped to midwicket
tossed up with more air, tucked to midwicket and it's a scampered single...Miller brings out the dive, but it wasn't needed
full outside off, mistimes an attempted drive
gets some fortune here, plays back to a delivery which slides on and takes an inside edge past leg stump
driven past a diving Maxwell in his followthrough, down to long-off
nicely bowled, goes on straight from round the wicket, takes a leading edge towards point
full and straight, lovely timing as he flicks it strongly through midwicket
on leg stump, flicked off the pads to deep square
good length outside off, defended
top shot from du Plessis as he strides forward to delivery outside off, not a half volley, and drives wide of mid-off. Lovely way to bring up the hundred
now he goes for a pull to a shorter delivery outside off, the ball scoots under the bottom edge
short of a length, tight to off stump 135kph, pushed towards point
full outside off, driven to deep cover
works this from outside off to the leg side
uses his feet and pushes down the ground
full, pushed into middle and leg, driven into midwicket with a straight bat...brings up the fifty stand which was much-needed
pushed back to the bowler
dropped by Carey...du Plessis looking to play a shorter delivery through the off side, a thin nick which he can't glove. Could be a big moment
back of a length at off stump, played with an open face to backward point
short of a length, carries at waist height through to Carey
a bouncer over middle, Miller ducks underneath
another short one, Miller again allows it go over his back
that's a terrific shot, stands tall and punches off the back foot through the covers at the top of the bounce
on middle and leg, worked off his pads down to long leg
nearly done in the air as he comes down the pitch, doesn't get to the ball, drives to the covers
leaves this alone outside off
full and straight, driven through the off side
goes on straight outside off from round the wicket, a leading edge into the off side
goes down on his back knee and sweeps this from outside off, hard square of the wicket. Good shot. That's how to play the fill-in bowler
and again, another sweep, this time goes behind square and straight to the man
back of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended with a closed face to midwicket
wild swing as du Plessis charges down the pitch and tries to hack a short-of-a-length delivery through the leg side
stays in his crease this time, flicks a straight delivery to long leg
a shorter delivery, Miller gets on his toes and defends it down by his feet
driven over the off side, the second time he's done that, coming forward into the shot, doesn't keep it down but it's timed sweetly and just clears the infield
a good short ball to end the over, he sways out of the line
stays round the wicket, pushed back to the bowler
slips this well down the leg side, Carey palms it away so an extra run
slides on outside off, left alone
touch shorter, he goes back and drives to deep cover
full and driven wide of cover
uses his feet, this is outside leg stump, knocked into midwicket as he nearly loses his balance
dragged from full outside off with a sweep, out to deep midwicket
back of a length on the pads, worked into midwicket
flicks a length delivery behind square on the leg side
full at off stump, a slower ball at 122kph, defended to the off side
a short slower ball, du Plessis is almost through his pull and it loops down to long leg
full, width outside off, driven towards cover who gets a hand on it with a drive, the throw from mid-off then cannons off the stumps for an extra run
that's a good-looking shot, driven on the up but straight to cover
angles the face and pushes into the covers
round the wicket, full and straight, nudged into the leg side
full at the stumps, driven to cover where Finch dives and saves

he's broken through! Been a good spell form Maxwell and he's pinned Miller lbw. Slides on from round the wicket. At the last moment they go for the review, du Plessis keen for it. Hits below the knee roll...well, well, I thought there may have been a small mark on Hot Spot but third umpire says not. But it's missing leg stump on the angle
very full, driven firmly to deep cover
taken from outside off into the leg side
134kph, back of a length, tucked behind square and they run really well to get a couple
140kph, tailing into off, he works it with the angle straight to midwicket
123kph slower ball, he tries to turn it to leg, gets a slight leading edge that rolls to cover
124kph, shorter slower ball outside off, tries to cut hard but mis times into the off side
mistimed pull top edge, just flies away from mid on! This was a good short ball, he top edges a pull and it loops just out of Finch's reach running back from mid on
cracking yorker, spearing into off, he digs this out well
cut away past point! Fractionally short and wide and he placed this nicely past backward point
looped up on leg, clipped out to deep midwicket
shorter length, punched off the back foot to deep cover
skips down the track and works with the spin to deep midwicket
looped up again, he's down the track, not quite there, works against the turn to midwicket
slightly shorter, he waits in the crease, knocks it in the gap at square leg
angled down leg, clipped nicely to fine leg
short outside off, cut hard to the sweeper at deep cover-point
short and cracks a pull shot to deep square! Great shot to bring up 50. That is two in a row. He was so quick to pull this away into the gap behind square
shorter again, he pulls hard but straight to the man at deep forward square
full outside off, driven nicely to long off. Fifty for Faf. His 30th in ODI cricket.
good length on off, he defends into the off side
edged closing the blade, it runs to short third man
superb sweep shot, struck magnificently behind square, Marsh runs around and makes a great save on the rope
advances down the track and tries to loft, but drags it through midwicket
attempted sweep, it goes under the bat outside off and taken by the keeper
clipped nicely into the gap at midwicket and they run very well
sweeps brilliantly behind square and it beats the sweeper! That was amazing placement to sweep it finer than the man on the rope
short ball, attempted pull, hits the body and flies up in the air but there was no bat and it landed safely
skips down and lofts it over mid off! Good batting. Mid off is up and he jumped down and lofted a length ball up and over the man in the ring
slower ball, pitched short, he rolls the wrists and pulls hard into the gap behind square
back of a length, cracked off the back foot wide of cover and the point sweeper has to come around to collect on the rope
short on the hip, pulled hard to deep square leg
the Dil scoop for four! Faf on fire. He was down early, ready to scoop ramp it from outside off to fine leg and the vacant rope
short and wide and cut straight to backward point
short outside off, he punches hard off the back foot to deep point
136kph, good length outside off, glided off the front foot down to third man
short ball into the body, 139kph, he pulls but mistimes around to deep fine leg
good length, 138kph, hits him on the thigh, half an appeal from Hazlewood but it is way too high
137kph, top of off, he dabs this into the gully and they take an easy one
skips down to a leg break, he works against the turn through forward square
short length, he punches off the back foot to cover
shuffles around the crease and launches a slog sweep over deep square into the Ricky Ponting stand!
tossed up on off, driven hard to long off
gives room, yorker length, chops off the inside edge to short fine
zipped through outside leg, he tries to slog sweep again but misses, it comes off pad and rolls away
good length, 142kph, pushes to mid on who is right on the circle and they take an easy one
short ball, 140kph, at the body, he pulls around to deep fine leg
cracked wide of long off! Wow. He's down the track and smashing this on the up in the air wide of cover and it beats long off on the rope
skips down again and launches over midwicket! Faf making a statement. He advanced again, it was banged in shorter and he went with it, picking it up and lofting over the midwicket rope
driven inside out on the up, straight of deep cover-point and he calls two immediately off the bat
141kph, yorker, speared into off, he has to jam down and defend
133kph, short on middle, tucked behind square and they sprint two. Great running to bring up the 150 partnership. What an effort from these two
132kph, bouncer and the square leg umpire calls it a wide on height and Paul Wilson stretches the arms out
short on the hip, he turns this to deep midwicket
135kph, short of a length on off, he's deep in the crease, turning this through square leg
pushed to cover and they take on Head, he shies at the bowlers but misses but Miller was well in
back of a length, 136kph, run slowly off the face to short third man for an easy one
pulled wide of fine leg and they sprint back for a second, the throw is just a touch high and Miller is able to scamper back in time
full on off, 141kph, driven hard down the ground to long off
driven hard inside out past cover and it forces long off to run around to cut it off
he charges and backs away to a short ball, upper cuts over short third man! He wasn't in control but it was a calculated slash up and over with no man back
punched off the back foot to deep point
sliced inside out over cover! What a stroke. He opened up the front leg, it was full he cracked it off the middle of the blade and placed it to the cover rope. Such a good shot
full and straight, driven down to long on
short slower ball, sticks in the surface, he tries to pull but is through the shot and gets hit on the chest
skips down, backs away, slower ball, he gets a little nick as he swings hard but it bounces well short of the keeper
full toss, nearly waist high, it surprises Faf, he bunts it away into the off side, asks whether it's a no ball but the square leg umpire rightly says no. It was stump high only
yorker, dug out into the leg side
slower ball, 126kph, short and wide, cut wide of third man and they run an easy two to Hazlewood on the rope
full toss, 143kph, he checks a drive to mid off and runs an easy one

attempted Dil-scoop, he misses, it flies to the keeper, they appeal for caught behind. Not out. Australia reviews. They think he hit this. Nothing on hot spot. It looks like it hit the left thigh. Nothing on snicko. Not out is the call from the third umpire. Australia lose the review
full toss, leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
slower ball onto the pads and he flicks this past short fine leg ! Great placement. It was too straight from Cummins
139kph, short ball, he pulls but mistimes, it rolls out to deep square
skips down and lofts up and over mid on in the circle! Great batting with the man up. He was down like a flash to the length and lifting it with the bottom hand
short and wide and cut hard in front of deep point and it beats the man! What timing from Faf! He smoked that. He moves to 99.
124kph slower ball bouncer, called wide on height over the batsman's head
full on middle, driven hard in the air for a distance to long on
short ball, pulled easily to deep square! A century for the skipper! His 10th in ODI cricket. He punches the air and celebrates. He gets a great applause from the rooms. What a super innings
short and fired way down the leg side
slower ball, full toss on leg, clipped away hard to deep forward square but straight to the man
yorker, dragged to mid on off the toe of the bat
shorter length on off, he drops it down into the off side
short ball, he backs away and slaps this, swats it straight down the ground to the sight screen! Amazing shot!
short outside off, ramped up and over short third man! Brilliant way to bring up his 5th ODI hundred! His second against Australia. This has been a magnificent innings
short down leg, he helps it around the corner to fine leg
clears the front leg and slogs this along the ground to deep midwicket
launched over square leg onto the hill! Goodness. The crack of the bat. It was a half-volley on leg stump and he picked it up and it went miles!
short into the ribs he pulls hard behind square and it beats fine leg!
skips down, backs away, one one knee cracks this in front of point! Are you kidding! That another superb shot. He hit this so hard from one knee
yorker, driven to mid off on the circle
launched up and over mid off and way over the rope! Supreme timing. He stood so still and the flow of the bat was sweet
back of a length, cracked to deep point
attempted yorker, becomes a half-volley, he smashes this straight of mid off and it flies to the fence with no one back on the rope straight
full toss, cracked just wide of midwicket, and it races away to the rope again! What placement and timing
short ball, pulled hard forward of square! Unbelievable striking from Faf
slower ball, he slices it up and over backward point and it rolls to the rope! 300 up!
yorker, leg stump, 129kph, he gets an inside edge, onto pad and it rolls away into the off side
One handed over cover! That is shot of the day! This was a half volley, he cleared the left leg but it was wide and he just threw the bat at it with one hand and it cleared the rope!

caught at deep cover-point! What a catch! It was a slower ball short and wide, it was almost above his head, he waits and lofts a swatted cut to the deep, Shaun Marsh runs in dives forward and takes a superb catch! The end of an outstanding innings from Faf de Plessis
slower ball, short again, he waits and slaps a pull shot hard behind square and he finds the rope! What placement and timing
short slower ball again, cracked again to deep square and Head slides on the rope to make the save
yorker length outside off, drilled down to long on
half volley, on leg, flicked hard behind square! He has hammered anything on his pads. Superb shot again
big swing and a miss! Finally a dot! It was back of a length across him

caught at deep midwicket! The carnage ends! It was a full toss in the hitting arc to go out of the park, he nailed it flat to deep midwicket, Finch caught it right on the rope, he tossed it up as he overbalanced, stepped outside the rope and the back in to complete a good catch.
good length, he backs away, misses trying to go inside out, it bounces over the stumps and they pinch one to the keeper as he shies and misses
half volley outside off, he slices it hard along the deck to deep point
starts with one down the leg side, so it's a wide to get going

edged, caught behind! The Lynn experiment hasn't worked. Short of a length outside off, Lynn aiming to drive off the back foot, playing away from his body, gets a thick edge which de Kock takes diving in front of first slip
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length, straight, tucked into midwicket
another one down the leg side, by a long way
not quite the right line, angled into the pads, timed nicely through square leg
good length, on middle, Finch uses his wrists to tuck it behind square
just back of a length, on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
short of a length outside off, 128kph, tucked into midwicket
back of a length, punched square of the wicket to point
good delivery, back of a length outside off, Finch feels for it away from his body as the ball holds its line off the seam
gets this a touch fuller, 133kph, defended into the covrs
defended on the move into the off side
flicks this away from off stump, wouldn't want to miss that, runs down to long leg
back of a length at off stump, 141kph, defended towards mid-off
this is a little fuller, 140kph, Finch gets onto the front foot and drives past Steyn
gets across his crease and times this very nicely through midwicket, using the pace on the ball
and now there's nice timing through the off side, punched at the top of the bounce between cover and mid-off
a shorter delivery outside off, driven into the covers and they spot the chance for a sharp single
that's a delightful shot, pitched up outside off, Marsh drives it elegantly straight of mid-off
good length outside off, hits the splice hard as Finch defends to cover
straight to mid-on! Early trouble for Australia. Finch tried to go over the top, driving on the up to a good-length delivery, and it's a dolly of the catch. The delivery may have gripped on the pitch
edged, but wide of second slip, came round the wicket straightaway, in the channel outside off, draws Head forward and he's certainly not in control
full at off stump, 135kph, defended to mid-off
touch wider outside off, left alone
lovely line and length, just outside off and angling back, Head leaves alone
works a short-of-a-length delivery off his hip through square leg
angled across on a good length outside off, left alone
short of a length at off stump, defended towards point
well bowled, this is fuller, Head's feet a little stuck and he gets an inside edge into his pads
short of a length outside off, 138kph, sweetly punched off the back foot to cover
fantastic fielding by the captain who is having a decent day, this cover drive was nailed by Head but du Plessis dived full length
stays round the wicket, full outside off, driven towards mid-off where Rabada pulls off another terrific stop
defended to the covers
another good drive from Marsh, gets across the crease and takes this from outside off straight of mid-on
crunched! This time he drives on the up, throwing everything into this shot and sends it rocketing through the covers
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, 136kph, defended to the bowler
short of a length, played off the back foot into midwicket
on off stump, 130kph, short of a length and defended
neatly played, jumps back in the crease and works this short delivery off his hip to deep square
some late movement back in at Marsh who is a little caught in two minds whether to be back or forward, pushes into the covers
on the stumps, a touch fuller, pushed back down the pitch
a little tentative against this short-of-a-length delivery, takes an inside edge and bobbles behind him
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length, through to the keeper
that's a cracking shot as he gets onto the front foot to a fuller delivery and pings a cover drive wide of mid-off
tries to drive again, not as much width this time, not in as good a position and takes an inside edge into his pads
another inside edge as he plays forward, defending at a length delivery
fuller at off stump, pushed to mid-on
he's chasing away from his body trying to drive, Rabada starts by flinging one across well outside off
short of a length, jumps into a cross-batted stroke and gets a bottom edge into the crease
makes good connection driving off the back foot, du Plessis makes another good save
full outside off, left alone
gets forward and drives on the up into the covers, once again it's the captain who intercepts
back of a length outside off, left alone and Rabada starts with a maiden
round the wicket, back of a length, driven to point
fuller at off stump, 137kph, pushed to mid-on
nicely into the drive as Ngidi goes full outside off, can't beat mid-off but far enough to his right to get the single
full outside off, he gets forward and drives...another dot ball to Head
a shorter delivery, he gets inside the line and flicks to deep square leg
good delivery, nips back off the seam and bounces down off Marsh's leg into the crease...isn't too far from rolling back into the stumps
top catch at backward point! Over the wicket, short of a length outside off, tries to drive square off the back foot and can't get over the top of the ball. Good, tumbling catch by Markram
back of a length at middle and off, defended
fuller, at off stump, 136kph and pushed back to the bowler
nips back off the seam from short of a length, rebounds off his thigh pad
good delivery, on off stump, defended to point
a touch shorter, he plays off the back foot and it's another maiden for Rabada
full outside off from over the wicket, pushed into the covers
back of a length at off stump, defended
fuller, at the stumps, a little caught on the crease but safely defended to mid-on
good length at off stump, 136kph, defended to cover
plays back to quite a full delivery, also right across his crease, worked into the leg side
full and straight, whips across his front pad through square leg
back of a length, straight, tucked around the corner down to long leg
across onto off stump, runs off an open face through backward point
good length outside off, pushed to deep cover
gets squared up a touch by this one, back of a length at off stump
a little fuller, outside off, 136kph and defended to mid-off
a good short ball, at the ribs as Stoinis gets right across his crease, fended down to the leg side
back of a length outside off, 127kph, defended to the covers
full outside off, a powerful drive through the covers out to the sweeper
short of a length outside off, played into the covers on the back foot
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
full outside off, 139kph, defended to the covers
back of a length outside off, played into the covers and not much happening for Australia against a very tight attack
full and straight, a sweetly-struck straight drive but right back at Rabada who gets low in his followthrough
a slower ball, on a good length outside off, the bottom hand comes off the bat
tight to middle and off, 135kph, defended to the off side
comes round the wicket, on a good length at off stump, defended to the off side ring
a shorter delivery which he nearly plays back onto the stumps, but it just bounces over the timber
back of a length outside off, played with an angled bat to point
a low full toss to start with but it's punched straight to short midwicket
good length outside off, defended coming forward
very full at off stump, driven just wide of Tahir down to long-off...a few ironic cheers around the ground at the run
uses his feet and then drives firmly to long-off
on the pads and worked through square leg
a googly, full and straight, pushed into the covers
starts short of a length at off stump, defended with a high left elbow to cover
fuller, at the pads, but he can't beat midwicket as he works it away
back of a length at off stump, carefully played back up the pitch
touch fuller at off stump, worked into the leg side and still can't get off strike
and now he breaks free, a full delivery at the stumps, lofted cleanly over wide mid-on
back of a length outside off, defended to cover
pushed through outside off, he pushes to the gap at point
wrong un, spins into the pad and runs down the leg side fine short fine
tossed up driven back to the bowler who misses it, it runs to long on
lofts inside out, check drive with the spin up and over cover! This was well controlled lofted wide of long off, pitched just short of the rope
leg break on off, defended back to the bowler
wrong un, shorter, pushed towards long on but midwicket cuts it off
short and wide, 126kph, he tries to cut but mistimes into the off side
126kph, good length, fourth stump, guided straight to backward point on the bounce
127kph, shorter length, tight to off, he late cuts to third man
126kph, short of a length, wide of off, he defends on the back foot to point
good length, 126kph, wide of off, he's jumping back across outside off and defending with the full face
124kph, good length wide of off, he square drives on the up straight to backward point
driven in the air with the spin towards long on but it's well short of the man on the rope
wrong un, outside off, defended to cover
wrong un, short on leg stump, clipped behind square to the sweeper
wrong un again, nudged to backward point, Stoinis was looking to run but was sent back
leg break on leg stump, clipped past midwicket to the sweeper but there's no second run
lofted, inside out again over cover, the man at wide long off gets around to field on the bounce
125kph, good length angled in to middle and off, he works this with the angle to midwicket
124kph back of a length on off, he's back and working to midwicket
128kph, shorter length on off, he's back and tucking this to the gap at square leg
angled into off, he works it square with the angle past the umpire to the sweeper
short and wide, and hammers a cut past point! Just enough width, too short, and he picked the gap, the filed got a touch but not enough to stop it running away
good length on off, he drives on the up straight to cover
whipped with the turn to midwicket, du Plessis misfields and allows a single
very full, squeezed out through square leg
shorter leg break, dropped close into the leg side and they run well to get one
leg break, shorter and wider, he waits and cuts to the sweeper at deep point
shorter length, punched off the back foot to deep long on
whacked over deep midwicket! This was a dragged down half tracker, he was back quickly, set up for the pull and smashed it over the fence at midwicket onto the hill. That was freebie for Stoinis
shorter length, on off, tucked just square of midwicket for a single
126kph, short and wide, he tries to cut but misses it just skidded a touch low, just enough to get under the bat
cracked off the back foot straight to point who is inside the circle
128kph, back of a length on middle, he tried to whip and it hits the thigh, runs away square for an extra
picked up and dispatched onto the hill! Too short, he swivelled on it quickly and pulled this up and over backward square. Fifty partnership up.
good length, fourth stump, knocks this with soft hands into the off side
launched over wide long on to the hill! What a strike. It was a wrong un tossed up outside off and he picked it, and just mowed it to the hill
tossed up, he slog sweeps again to the midwicket rope! He got to one knee and smacked it flat to the vacant midwicket fence
pushed through flatter outside off, he knocks it away to point
flatter on off, he tucks this straight to midwicket
slower wrong un, he's forward and defending to cover
attempted sweep, hit on the pad, big appeal from Tahir, not out. Clearly pitched outside leg. Faf ignores the pleas from Tahir for a review. Rightly so
133kph, good length outside off, he's back and across and defending
angled into top of off, he tucks to the right of Klaasen at midwicket and they pinch a tight one. Marsh was well in after Klaasen fielded and shied at the striker's end
good length, tight to off, he defends from the crease
134kph, good length fourth stump line, he nudges away to point
137kph, full toss, it surprised Marsh, he tried to turn to leg and get a leading edge to cover
lofted up and over mid on! It wasn't a half-volley, he hit through the line, mistimed it a fraction but he got enough to fly over Tahir's head on the circle at mid on and it races away
attempted sweep, hits the pad, huge appeal again, not out. Again hit well outside the line
tossed up, driven hard to long on along the ground
looped up slower, he shuffles out and drives hard to long on with the turn
tossed up wide of off, it spins wide of the guideline and is called
short and wide and cut neatly between backward point and short third man! Great placement and batsmanship
climbs into this, launching it over long on into the stands!Fifty for Stoinis. He points to his chest. He is in for this fight
tossed up, leg break, he drives to cover
137kph, good length, middle and off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
125kph, pushed with the angle down the leg side
125kph, slower ball, angled into leg stump, it tucks him up, hits the pad and drops down at his feet

A magnificent front foot pull over midwicket! That's a way to reach fifty! This was hammered so hard. It was dropped short and he flat batted up on to the concourse. That's as hard as any ball struck today
139kph, good length, he tries to drive on the up, mistimes and drags to mid on
fuller 140kph, driven straight of mid on and runs with the stroke
short outside off, 137kph, he steps back and across and rides the bounce glancing it off the back foot to fine leg
120kph, wide and it kicks off the length, it flew way over the bat and surprises Stoinis. de Kock took it above his head
121kph, good length, this stays low he defends off the bottom of the bat
121kph, good length, outside off, he's back and across and working to midwicket
122kph, straighter to off, he works with the angle to midwicket from the stumps
123kph, good length, he tries to force off the back foot but picks out cover
back of a length, off stump, he's back and across and clipping it through square to the sweeper
shorter on off, he's back and punching to long on
flatter and pushed through, he's back given room and punching hard to deep cover

tries to sweep and given LBW! Stoinis reviews immediately. Did it pitch outside leg? He is coming from around the wicket. Not much turn. It pitched inline but he got a big inside edge! The decision is overturned
pushed through, he's back and punching straight to cover
flatter and shorter outside off, he cuts to backward point and Hendricks makes a good save
shorter on off, he punches straight to cover and Stoinis admonishes himself about not hitting the gap
another pick up pull into the stands! Fractionally short, he plays a cracking pull shot, it flies into the stands onto the concourse and a police officer takes a great catch, falling over a chair!
good length, he's back and punching down to long on
half-volley, outside off, he's back and across and flicking incredibly behind square but he can't beat the sweeper on the rope
short outside off, 123kph, a bit of extra bounce, he late cuts to short third man
flicked up over the midwicket rope! This was a half-volley on middle and leg and he just clipped it up and over midwicket

caught at backward point! What a mistake! This was short and wide but he cuts in the air, he didn't go up or keep it down, just hits it chest high to Markram who takes the easy catch! That's a huge blow for Australia
sweeps behind square! Bad ball. Full drifting down leg, and he sweeps easily past backward square
shorter outside off, he's back and cracking this to deep cover-point
tossed up on off, he's forward and defending back to the bowler
drifting to leg stump, he tucks this square of midwicket
drifting to leg, he clips this hard to wide long on, wants two immediately but Rabada fires a rocket from the fence to prevent it
pushed through shorter, he's back and forcing straight to cover
short on off, he;s back and clipping this behind square, and he's placed it well, they sprint back for two
125kph, good length, into off, he runs this off the open face down to third man
125kph, short on off, he's back and knocking this in front of square on the leg side
123kph, good length, off stump, he defends towards point
124kph, good length on off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
shorter down leg, he tries to pull again but it hurries onto it, comes off the glove, bounces just short of a diving de Kock, it rolls away and Carey is quick to call a single
pushed through on off, he's back and cutting into the gap for a single
tossed up, full toss, he drives along the ground to long on
good length on off, he just pushes down to long on
slog sweep against the turn, square of midwicket! He yelled 'oh no' as he hit it thinking he might have picked out midwicket but it was square of him
driven along the ground to deep cover
tossed up, driven along the ground down to long on
130kph, good length, dropped close on the off side, Carey has to hurry, he just beats Markram, who hit with the underarm. He was in by one foot! That was really tight
knocked to midwicket and again they try to pinch one, Klaasen had Marsh cold but he misfielded!
angled into leg, he clips this nicely behind  square for an easy two
135kph, angled into the pads, he gets a thin edge onto pad and it rolls away square
driven powerfully on the up, glorious stroke but straight to deep cover point
beaten by a beauty, good length, nipping away, he tried to run it to third man but misses
extra bounce and takes the splice of the bat to the off side
back of a length at off stump, angled bat finds backward point
tight stuff, back of a length at middle, no width to work with, played back to the bowler
another one into the crowd as Steyn drops short, terrific pick up by Carey as he swivels on a pull
back on a full length outside off, miscued to mid-on
driven out to deep cover
short of a length outside off, angled down fine of third man so it's a comfortable brace
a very tough chance as this is drilled back at Ngidi, who gets his right hand down to it. Got to say that saved a boundary. Came back so fast
back of a length at off stump, angled behind point to third man
a good hand on this at cover, Hendricks diving to his right, as Marsh crunches a cover drive
a strong cut shot as he's offered a touch of width, but Rabada is very fast at third man and keeps them to a single
miles over the leg side again! He's on the march. Just back of a length outside off, he fetches it with a might swing and it's well back into the seats
full and straight, 142kph, played into the on side
full outside off, punched on the up to deep cover
super piece of timing as he places this between cover and mid-off, but it's a good chase by du Plessis
back of a length, angled to third man
on off stump, short of a length, can't beat backward point
a short ball just down the leg side, Marsh doesn't connect with a pull and gets the wide call. So close to his hip
short of a length, a little cramped as he pulls this, perhaps didn't quite bounce as expected, sends it to deep square
round the wicket, full and straight, clipped to deep square
drives a length ball wide of point
angled into the pads again, worked along the ground to deep midwicket
a length delivery at the stumps, pushed to long-on
flicked from off stump into midwicket, doesn't go beyond the fielding circle but they get back for a second. Excellent running
drags the length back, on off stump, tucked into midwicket. Decent over from Pretorius
over the wicket, short of a length on off stump, played to backward point
full outside leg stump, gets a tickle into the pads and it runs towards short fine leg
a yorker outside leg stiump, 135kph, dug out to midwicket
short outside leg, he backs away to the leg side and upper cuts towards third man and goes one bounce to the man
tucks a back-of-a-length delivery into square leg
another short ball is ramped down to third man, again not too far from carrying all the way
round the wicket, back of a length at off stump, a front-foot pull to deep square
angled into the pads, tucked behind square and that's good work in the deep
drives at a length delivery, opens the face and runs it to third man
fuller at off stump, bunted down the ground to long-on
just back of a length, a heave to the leg side and there's not much timing...more swift work at deep square
full outside off, gets forward and drives into the covers but can't beat the man on the edge of the circle. Marsh to 98
there's his hundred, a brilliant innings from Marsh...drills this delivery just to the left of Tahir and long-on can't stop the second
uses his feet, Tahir saw him coming, dragged it slower and wider, manages to drive to deep cover
dragged down shorter, gets a bottom edge on the pull and it runs to short fine leg
dragged from outside off, pulled down to long-on
gives himself some room to the leg side then drives into the covers
power and placement from Marsh, stays in his crease to a full delivery, opens his stance and drills a skimming drive between cover and long-off
round the wicket, short of a length, shoveled to deep midwicket

taken at deep midwicket! Marsh can't beyond his ton. Massive, massive moment. That came down with snow on it. A short-of-a-length delivery, Marsh was aiming to clear the leg side again but could only send it high into the night sky. Klaasen had an age to think about the catch as it came, but held on securely
short, angled into the hip, pulled to deep square
what a way to get off the mark as he swivels on a pull, takes the ball from outside off to split long leg and deep square
full outside off, driven powerfully to the sweeper
length at off stump, pushed down the ground and this will be the other aspect of Maxwell at the crease - superb running
backs away to the leg side, it's a slow ball outside off, heaved into midwicket
big full toss from round the wicket, pumped down to long-on
another big full toss, Maxwell moving all over the crease, the ball thuds into the top of his leg and rebounds away. There's an ask for lbw...far too high
dropped at fine leg by Pretorius! Not an easy chance. A big top edge as Carey pulled at a slower ball. He never looked steady coming in and shelled it close to the ground. Had no base for the catch
gets the yorker in, straight, dug out down the ground
oh, well, think that may be a harsh wide call. Maxwell backs miles outside leg, Ngidi bowled it wide outside off but it went over the marker the umpire uses. Yeah, tough call I reckon for the bowler
full outside off, carved to deep cover
power from Maxwell, it just a fraction short outside off, fetched over midwicket with a stinging pull shot
full and straight, good ball, driven into the off side
round the wicket, low full toss, flicked to midwicket on the edge of the circle. Hits with the throw, they try to steal an extra run but it's not on
full toss outside leg, he's back away and drives to long-off. They do well to get two there
ah, well bowled, defeats him with a slower ball, short of a length, and he's through his shot far too early

they have called for a review here, Maxwell moved right across his stumps and it was a yorker heading to leg stump which glanced the boot as it went through to de Kock. Ah, it actually glanced the pad and is missing another set of stumps. But it's a dot ball
back of a length, straight, hitting the pitch hard, played to the off side
short outside off stump, tries to ramp it down to third man, defeated by the change of pace and it's not called wide
gets this over the off side, Steyn stayed short, Maxwell moved to the leg side and cut this in the air over point
short again, Maxwell almost throws himself off his feet as he swings to leg, doesn't make contact
short of a length, a crunching pull through midwicket but just a single
edged, caught behind! Carey backing away to leg then tried to carve through the off side, could only get a top edge through to de Kock. More reward for the excellent Steyn
excellent delivery, gets the yorker in at off stump, all Maxwell can do is squirt it to backward point
full outside off, swing and miss, another valuable dot ball
fantastic yorker, such skill, fired in just outside off stump and Cummins plays over it
another yorker on target outside off, he can't make contact, and this is brilliant from Ngidi
swing and miss outside off, another full one, maybe not quite the yorker this time...four dots in a row
fresh air again as Cummins misses his fifth in a row, that was probably there to drive, wasn't quite yorker length but superb stuff from Ngidi
short, huge swing to the leg side, flies off the top edge towards third man and he loses the strike again
low full toss, straight, he gets bat on it to big cheers
gets the leg-stump yorker, it's a sweetly-struck drive in response, and they get a couple as cover cuts it off
moves over the off side, picks up a length delivery and pulls towards fine leg, a very good tumbling save on the boundary from Ngidi. His knee caught in the turf which is worrying, hope he's okay
follows him with a short ball as he moves to the leg side, it's too short
beaten this time, gives himself too much to the leg side, Rabada keeps it full outside off
a low full toss, he actually stands still this time and pushes down the ground to keep the strike
just evades Hendricks in the deep, Maxwell heaved a length ball towards wide long-on. The fielder couldn't quite get there, but does an excellent job to recover and prevent the boundary
carved out to deep cover
full outside off, drives firmly but straight to mid-off inside the circle
this could be costly, a big full toss which he manages to pull between deep square and long leg...well fielded, Maxwell asks about the no-ball, but the umpires say it's okay
another pinpoint yorker, on off stump, jabbed into the off side
misses the yorker this time, it's a full delivery at the stumps, Cummins is able to get underneath it and club wide of long-on
a cross-seamer from Steyn, full outside off, carved over mid-off without timing it cleanly
backs to leg and has a swing and a miss to a short delivery
finds deep cover and that's that, a sliced lofted cover drive. Pretty comfortable catch for Hendricks. Another for Steyn who has been outstanding
beats him a short ball as Cummins pulls
another short one outside off, Cummins can't connect. Lot of effort in this innings without much reward
another dot ball, 141kph, short of a length and he's through the shot too early (despite the pace)
well, that's pretty soft...round the wicket, back of a length, and Starc just chips it straight up in the air
backs away to leg, short of a length, and has a swing and a miss
full, straight, can only jab it back to the bowler
another one for Rabada, a short ball angled in at Zampa who can only shovel it towards midwicket where the captain takes it tracking backwards
low full toss which he whips to midwicket
a short ball outside leg stump, goes over his back and it's called wide...a few smiles around
and quite aptly it's a yorker to finish, dug out to the covers
